comment: I've now taken two of Professor Majumder's online classes, and both of them were nearly identical with the exception of subject matter. While his classes are an easy A- just post the discussions and turn in the midterm/final- his lectures are INCREDIBLY slow and boring. He never sounds like he's prepared. Just prepare yourself to put up with him.

Kind of a boring class but it was an easy A. I took the class online and there were no exams or quizzes. Most of the assignments were discussions based on the reading/lectures with an essay as the midterm but the professor is an easy grader so as long as you do what you're supposed to then you should pass without any problems.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I took this professor online and honestly it was great. His grading is pretty easy. There were only class discussions, and one paper which was the midterm, no final exams or quizzes. Super easy A and I learned a lot too!

Took Dr. Majumder for Cultural Anthro, very knowledge on subject. He is passionate about the material. I took him for a 4 week class during the summer, so it was pretty dense. Discussion posts are easy, as well as final paper. Easy A!

He is very knowledgable and enthusiastic about the subject matter but is also very unorganized and doesn't explain the content that well. We only had two projects and some discussions as grades. He didn't give any feedback on the projects and just wrote an A on it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Majumder is an interesting prof. The class is clearly taught with a leftist narrative, but nonetheless it's pretty enjoyable. The prof leads really passionate discussions that again, seem to serve a narrative but if you're witty you'll be able to put your two cents in. Though a little sporadic, Majumder is at least interesting to listen to.

Super easy class. Kind of boring and pointless, but I think that had more to do with the course content than the professor. The professor is really nice and knowledgeable. If you're looking for a low-maintenance summer class that won't ruin your summer, this is it.

Easiest and most boring class. Don't expect to know your grade until they get finalized. The discussions aren't even mandatory. Midterm is an essay and so is the final. Unless you're a tech major or something similar this class is pointless. He's very unorganized and just made the class basically teach the class with presentations on each chapter

The most boring class you will ever take. My class was hybrid, and he told us that we would have a weekly online assignment but we only had maybe 6 the entire semester. Midterm was an essay over what is discussed/read in class. Relatively easy if you talk about everything discussed throughout the course.
Nice professor, study and you will pass the midterm with an A. Listen and participate in class discussions and you will do well on your final paper. Do all of these things & an "A" is inevitable.

I had Majumder for Theory ( onlinesummer).  I found the online lectures a bit lengthy & not always straight forward. Often, the powerpoints would not line up with what was being said which was distracting. Majumder does have an accent which takes concentration to understand online. If I had a redo, I would take the course in person.

Consists of a group discussion, one midterm, and a language autobiography. Make sure you attend class and plan on reading numerous articles. Professor Majumder is a nice person. Don't be afraid to ask if you need help!

Linguistic Anthropology is a concept heavy course that requires thinking and reading regularly. If you are lazy do not take this class.  He does an excellent job of decoding the concepts and bringing outside material to explain them to us. He loves the subject and shows a lot of excitement for student participation and the final projects. Take him

The course material is not presented clearly, but he is a very easy grader. I struggled with the material, but the course was an easy A. 1 midterm, language autobiography presentation, and paper. EASY grader. Also, very nice guy.

Only take him it's mandatory. Textbook only cited twice, thus, the expenses were a waste. He struggles explaining, deconstructing & simplifying the concepts of the course. He's very biased towards certain students of a particular appearance and he biased against certain students of another particular appearance.

class was a pleasure to attend and an incredibly easy A.  Asian Studies consisted of guest lecturers from all fields of study, many cultural videos, and a few short papers. Dr Majumder is articulate (slight accent) and really cares about his students/discussions in class. GPA booster and great educational experience. HIGHLY recommended

Honestly, although there is a language barrier with Dr. Majumder the class is not all that bad. The weekly readings were perhaps the most difficult part of the course. Other than that he teaches by class discussions and attempts to make his students critically think to fully understand the material. Work hard and you'll get the grade you deserve!!

There have been only two days out of the entire semester in where he has actually attempted to teach the class. His version of teaching is a class discussion..Every day there is either another teacher teaching the class or a movie. Nothing but response papers. No grades returned. Impossible to get in contact with.

Plan on self-teaching if you take this professor.  The language barrier is a challenge, so be prepared.  This professor is very vague about assignments.  There were no tests, but he does have an oral group presentation, several book assignments, as well as a final paper. You will not learn in this class.

I took him for an Intro to Asia class: the class was very easy. He does tend to gloss over answers that you might give that aren't what he's looking for, but still addresses them. Very respectful of the class. Had many guest lecturers, & papers on each. Hardly used the book, readings posted online. Midterm was the only test and final was a project.

Attendance is pretty flexible. Tries to be helpful, but is hard to contact outside class and never checks his email. Readings are all articles posted online. ONLY 1 TEST (midterm); final is a project. Has a tendency to gloss over responses if it's not what he's looking for, & isn't always very clear about what he wants, but this class was so easy!
